title: Commuter chaos as a cow falls off the back of a slaughterhouse truck on Monash Freeway
text:
A cow has caused commuter chaos after falling off the back of a slaughterhouse truck onto a busy motorway.

City-bound cars were brought to a halt during the Friday morning peak hour rush on the Monash Freeway, in Melbourne's south west, as the right lane was closed and the speed limit dropped to 40kph.

Police were contacted to manage traffic around 6.30am and secured the cow to a fence in the middle of the highway while they waited for animal rescuers Warriors 4 Wildlife to arrive with a horse float.

City bound cars were brought to a halt during the Friday morning peak hour rush on Monash Freeway, in Melbourne's south west, as the right lane was closed and the speed limit dropped to 40kmph

The animal was peacefully grazing in the median strip, near Clyde Road, but became resistant as rescuers tried to coax him into the vehicle, causing a three-hour stand-off.

He was taken to a vet for multiple grazes.

Drivers were delayed up to an hour and a half as they travelled through the affected intersection.

The charity organisation, who have named him Clyde after the nearby thoroughfare, believe the cow fell from a slaughter house truck, according to 10 Daily.

Rescuers said he will become part of the family, joining other cows and an array of other pets at the shelter, if no one comes forward to claim him.

Victoria Police said how the bovine ended up there is yet to be confirmed.
description: A cow caused commuter chaos on Friday after falling off the back of a slaughterhouse truck onto the Monash Freeway in Melbourne.
authors: Tita Smith For Daily Mail Australia
